Opinions expressed do not necessarily reflect the views of TIME editors.","parent":0,"count":5721,"filter":"raw","all_sections":["ideas","politics"]}]}},{"id":4645846,"date":"2017-01-25T16:30:25","date_gmt":"2017-01-25T21:30:25","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F?p=4645846"},"modified":"2017-01-25T16:30:00","modified_gmt":"2017-01-25T21:30:00","slug":"what-to-know-about-the-casey-affleck-oscar-controversy","type":"post","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4645846\u002Fwhat-to-know-about-the-casey-affleck-oscar-controversy\u002F","title":{"rendered":"What to Know About the Casey Affleck Oscar Controversy"},"content":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003ECasey Affleck has won over a dozen awards, including a \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4628608\u002Fgolden-globes-2017-winners-oscar-predictions\u002F\"\u003EGolden Globe\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, for his performance in \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4575255\u002Fmanchester-by-the-sea-movie-review\u002F\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EManchester by the Sea\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, and with \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4622027\u002Fgolden-globes-2017-winners\u002F\"\u003ETuesday&#8217;s nominations\u003C\u002Fa\u003E he became a favorite to win the best actor Oscar in February. Though expected, the news has elicited objections from actors, activists and commentators on the grounds the Academy disregarded sexual harassment allegations made in two settled lawsuits against the 41-year-old actor. The most outspoken critic has been \u003Cem\u003EFresh Off the Boat\u003C\u002Fem\u003E star Constance Wu, who posted \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FConstanceWu\u002Fstatus\u002F823906218963939328?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Ea series\u003C\u002Fa\u003E of \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FConstanceWu\u002Fstatus\u002F823908642705412096?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Estrongly worded\u003C\u002Fa\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FConstanceWu\u002Fstatus\u002F823914886463766528?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Etweets\u003C\u002Fa\u003E shortly after the nominations. A number of entertainment \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fprojects.fivethirtyeight.com\u002Foscar-predictions-2017\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Eoutlets\u003C\u002Fa\u003E also \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fthinkprogress.org\u002Fwhy-arent-sexual-harassment-allegations-derailing-casey-affleck-s-oscar-chances-946d9d3dcc5d\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Epublished\u003C\u002Fa\u003E or \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.thedailybeast.com\u002Farticles\u002F2016\u002F11\u002F22\u002Fcasey-affleck-s-dark-secret-the-disturbing-allegations-against-the-oscar-hopeful.html?via=twitter_page\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Ere-promoted\u003C\u002Fa\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fthehairpin.com\u002Ffamiliarize-yourself-with-casey-afflecks-sexual-harassment-allegations-a09d362a6590#.2hp1ee6qg\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Estories\u003C\u002Fa\u003E about Affleck.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"video-container\"\u003E\u003Cvideo id=\"brightcove-player-5294815106001\" data-video-id=\"5294815106001\" data-account=\"293884104\" data-player=\"SJa0Thl7\" data-embed=\"default\" autoplay controls preload=\"auto\" class=\"video-js responsive-video\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fvideo\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EHere is what you need to know about the controversy:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EThe allegations date from seven years ago.\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIn 2010, two women who had worked on Affleck&rsquo;s experimental film\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.imdb.com\u002Ftitle\u002Ftt1356864\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003E I&rsquo;m Still Here\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E filed sexual harassment suits against him. One of the women claimed that Affleck crawled into bed with her without her consent while she was asleep. He allegedly pressured the other woman to stay in his hotel room and &ldquo;violently grabbed [her] arm in an effort to intimidate her into staying&rdquo; when she refused, according to the complaint.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe women claimed he verbally disparaged them and directed a subordinate to expose himself to one of them, among other types of misconduct. They also said that Affleck and the film&#8217;s star, Joaquin Phoenix, locked themselves in the women&#8217;s shared hotel room with two other women, allegedly to have sex with them. The full complaints are available \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fabcnews.go.com\u002Fimages\u002FEntertainment\u002FGorka_complaint.pdf\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Ehere\u003C\u002Fa\u003E and \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fabcnews.go.com\u002Fimages\u002FEntertainment\u002FWhite%20Complaint.pdf\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Ehere\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EThe claims were settled out of court.\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAffleck was sued for $2 million by one woman and $2.25 million by the other. Both cases were settled out of court for an undisclosed amount in 2010.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAffleck has repeatedly denied the allegations.\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAt the time the suits were filed, Affleck denied the claims and threatened to countersue. Affleck&#8217;s lawyer initially \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fpeople.com\u002Fcrime\u002Fcasey-affleck-sued-for-sexual-harassment-and-hell-sue-back\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Etold\u003C\u002Fa\u003E \u003Cem\u003EPeople:\u003C\u002Fem\u003E &ldquo;The complaint will be vigorously defended and cross-claims will be filed.&rdquo; They never did counter-sue and settled out of court.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EWhen he was profiled by the \u003Cem\u003ENew York Times \u003C\u002Fem\u003Ein 2016, he \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.nytimes.com\u002F2016\u002F11\u002F06\u002Fmovies\u002Fcasey-affleck-interview-manchester-by-the-sea.html\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Eresponded to the allegations\u003C\u002Fa\u003E via email. &#8220;It was settled to the satisfaction of all. I was hurt and upset&mdash;I am sure all were&mdash;but I am over it,&rdquo; he wrote. &ldquo;It was an unfortunate situation&mdash;mostly for the innocent bystanders of the families of those involved.&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIn a \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fvariety.com\u002F2016\u002Ffilm\u002Fnews\u002Fcasey-affleck-manchester-by-the-sea-1201891603\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EVariety\u003C\u002Fem\u003E cover story\u003C\u002Fa\u003E last fall, Affleck said: &ldquo;People say whatever they want. Sometimes it doesn&rsquo;t matter how you respond&#8230; I guess people think if you&rsquo;re well-known, it&rsquo;s perfectly fine to say anything you want. I don&rsquo;t know why that is. But it shouldn&rsquo;t be because everybody has families and lives.&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAffleck&#8217;s critics fault the Academy for recognizing him.\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EJournalists, from FiveThirtyEight editor-in-chief \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FNateSilver538\u002Fstatus\u002F823925114286800905\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ENate Silver\u003C\u002Fa\u003E to \u003Cem\u003ENew York Times\u003C\u002Fem\u003E and \u003Cem\u003ENew York Magazine\u003C\u002Fem\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002Fangelicabastien\u002Fstatus\u002F823925983690588161\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Ewriter\u003C\u002Fa\u003E Angelica Jade and \u003Cem\u003ERolling Stone\u003C\u002Fem\u003E film critic \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002Fpetertravers\u002Fstatus\u002F818305328836149248\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EPeter Travers\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, have called out Affleck on Twitter, as has actress Wu.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe thrust of the critics&#8217; arguments is that receiving an Oscar&mdash;even just being nominated&mdash;will likely lead to Affleck gaining more power, money and influence in Hollywood. Granting men accused of hurting women more power, they say, perpetuates a cycle of sexism in the industry. Jade, for instance, argued it was hypocritical for the Academy to \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theguardian.com\u002Ffilm\u002F2016\u002Fjan\u002F22\u002Foscars-diversity-race-minority-members-academy-awards\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Epromote greater diversity\u003C\u002Fa\u003E (including gender diversity) at the same time as nominating Affleck.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EWu wrote, &#8220;He&rsquo;s running for an award that honors a craft whose purpose is examining the dignity of the human experience &amp; young women are deeply human&#8221; and then went on to suggest that the clout of the Affleck family has kept some silent in Hollywood. (Actor Matt Damon produced \u003Cem\u003EManchester by the Sea\u003C\u002Fem\u003E.) She tweeted, &#8220;I&#8217;ve been counseled not to talk about this for career&#8217;s sake. F my career then, I&#8217;m a woman &amp; human first. That&#8217;s what my craft is built on.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAffleck seemed to address the controversy at the Golden Globes.\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EDuring his \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.youtube.com\u002Fwatch?v=pIeKo6gYNFo\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Eacceptance speech\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, Affleck alluded to the &#8220;noise&#8221; that comes with fame, which some interpreted as a reference to the lawsuits and the press surrounding them. &ldquo;Despite how I might think I&rsquo;m in charge at my house, it&rsquo;s my kids who give me permission to do this because they have got the strength of character to keep at bay all the noise that sometimes surrounds people who live publicly,&rdquo; he said. (A few outlets also \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Felitedaily.com\u002Fentertainment\u002Fcelebrity\u002Fbrie-larsons-casey-affleck-golden-globe\u002F1745358\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Enoted\u003C\u002Fa\u003E that actress Brie Larson, who presented Affleck with his award at the Globes, did not hug him or shake his hand as is customary.)\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EThe case has drawn comparisons to other high-profile scandals in Hollywood.\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe Academy has a long history with nominees who have been accused of misconduct. Roman Polanski fled the country after he was \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.huffingtonpost.com\u002F2014\u002F04\u002F10\u002Froman-polanski-rape_n_5126208.html\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Earrested\u003C\u002Fa\u003E for and pled guilty to the rape of a 13-year-old girl and has since won an Oscar. Woody Allen has been \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fkristof.blogs.nytimes.com\u002F2014\u002F02\u002F01\u002Fan-open-letter-from-dylan-farrow\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Eaccused of sexually abusing his adopted daughter\u003C\u002Fa\u003E but has been honored by the Oscars.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theguardian.com\u002Ffilm\u002F2017\u002Fjan\u002F06\u002Fcasey-affleck-sexual-harassment-nate-parker-hollywood\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EMany\u003C\u002Fa\u003E \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.theverge.com\u002F2016\u002F12\u002F8\u002F13836786\u002Fcasey-affleck-sexual-harassment-lawsuit-oscars-woody-allen\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Ehave\u003C\u002Fa\u003E \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.hollywoodreporter.com\u002Fnews\u002Foscars-mel-gibson-casey-affleck-hollywoods-sliding-scale-moral-punishment-956988\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Eargued\u003C\u002Fa\u003E that Affleck&#8217;s nomination is just the latest example of the Academy&#8217;s longstanding tradition of ignoring harassment allegations. This argument was bolstered by this year&#8217;s surprise nomination of Mel Gibson, who was caught on tape in a drunken anti-Semitic rant in 2006 and later \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fpeople.com\u002Fcrime\u002Fmel-gibson-sentenced-to-counseling-probation-in-battery-case\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Epled no contest to misdemeanor battery\u003C\u002Fa\u003E in 2011 for hitting his ex-girlfriend repeatedly in the face.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Casey Affleck has won over a dozen awards, including a ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4628608\u002Fgolden-globes-2017-winners-oscar-predictions\u002F"},"content":["Golden Globe"]},", for his performance in ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4575255\u002Fmanchester-by-the-sea-movie-review\u002F"},"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["Manchester by the Sea"]}]},", and with ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4622027\u002Fgolden-globes-2017-winners\u002F"},"content":["Tuesday's nominations"]}," he became a favorite to win the best actor Oscar in February. Though expected, the news has elicited objections from actors, activists and commentators on the grounds the Academy disregarded sexual harassment allegations made in two settled lawsuits against the 41-year-old actor. The most outspoken critic has been ",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["Fresh Off the Boat"]}," star Constance Wu, who posted ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FConstanceWu\u002Fstatus\u002F823906218963939328?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw","target":"_blank"},"content":["a series"]}," of ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FConstanceWu\u002Fstatus\u002F823908642705412096?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw","target":"_blank"},"content":["strongly worded"]}," ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FConstanceWu\u002Fstatus\u002F823914886463766528?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw","target":"_blank"},"content":["tweets"]}," shortly after the nominations. Woody Allen has been ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fkristof.blogs.nytimes.com\u002F2014\u002F02\u002F01\u002Fan-open-letter-from-dylan-farrow\u002F"},"content":["accused of sexually abusing his adopted daughter"]}," but has been honored by the Oscars."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theguardian.com\u002Ffilm\u002F2017\u002Fjan\u002F06\u002Fcasey-affleck-sexual-harassment-nate-parker-hollywood"},"content":["Many"]}," ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.theverge.com\u002F2016\u002F12\u002F8\u002F13836786\u002Fcasey-affleck-sexual-harassment-lawsuit-oscars-woody-allen"},"content":["have"]}," ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.hollywoodreporter.com\u002Fnews\u002Foscars-mel-gibson-casey-affleck-hollywoods-sliding-scale-moral-punishment-956988"},"content":["argued"]}," that Affleck's nomination is just the latest example of the Academy's longstanding tradition of ignoring harassment allegations. This argument was bolstered by this year's surprise nomination of Mel Gibson, who was caught on tape in a drunken anti-Semitic rant in 2006 and later ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fpeople.com\u002Fcrime\u002Fmel-gibson-sentenced-to-counseling-probation-in-battery-case\u002F"},"content":["pled no contest to misdemeanor battery"]}," in 2011 for hitting his ex-girlfriend repeatedly in the face."]}],"plain":"Casey Affleck has won over a dozen awards, including a Golden Globe, for his performance in Manchester by the Sea, and with Tuesday&#8217;s nominations he became a favorite to win the best actor Oscar in February. Though expected, the news has elicited objections from actors, activists and commentators on the grounds the Academy disregarded sexual harassment allegations made in two settled lawsuits against the 41-year-old actor. The most outspoken critic has been Fresh Off the Boat star Constance Wu, who posted a series of strongly worded tweets shortly after the nominations. A number of entertainment outlets also published or re-promoted stories about Affleck. Here is what you need to know about the controversy: The allegations date from seven years ago. In 2010, two women who had worked on Affleck&rsquo;s experimental film I&rsquo;m Still Here filed sexual harassment suits against him. One of the women claimed that Affleck crawled into bed with her without her consent while she was asleep. He allegedly pressured the other woman to stay in his hotel room and &ldquo;violently grabbed [her] arm in an effort to intimidate her into staying&rdquo; when she refused, according to the complaint. The women claimed he verbally disparaged them and directed a subordinate to expose himself to one of them, among other types of misconduct. They also said that Affleck and the film&#8217;s star, Joaquin Phoenix, locked themselves in the women&#8217;s shared hotel room with two other women, allegedly to have sex with them. The full complaints are available here and here. The claims were settled out of court. Affleck was sued for $2 million by one woman and $2.25 million by the other. Both cases were settled out of court for an undisclosed amount in 2010. Affleck has repeatedly denied the allegations. At the time the suits were filed, Affleck denied the claims and threatened to countersue. Affleck&#8217;s lawyer initially told People: &ldquo;The complaint will be vigorously defended and cross-claims will be filed.&rdquo; They never did counter-sue and settled out of court. When he was profiled by the New York Times in 2016, he responded to the allegations via email. &#8220;It was settled to the satisfaction of all. I was hurt and upset&mdash;I am sure all were&mdash;but I am over it,&rdquo; he wrote. &ldquo;It was an unfortunate situation&mdash;mostly for the innocent bystanders of the families of those involved.&rdquo; In a Variety cover story last fall, Affleck said: &ldquo;People say whatever they want. Sometimes it doesn&rsquo;t matter how you respond&#8230; I guess people think if you&rsquo;re well-known, it&rsquo;s perfectly fine to say anything you want. I don&rsquo;t know why that is. But it shouldn&rsquo;t be because everybody has families and lives.&rdquo; Affleck&#8217;s critics fault the Academy for recognizing him. Journalists, from FiveThirtyEight editor-in-chief Nate Silver to New York Times and New York Magazine writer Angelica Jade and Rolling Stone film critic Peter Travers, have called out Affleck on Twitter, as has actress Wu. The thrust of the critics&#8217; arguments is that receiving an Oscar&mdash;even just being nominated&mdash;will likely lead to Affleck gaining more power, money and influence in Hollywood. Granting men accused of hurting women more power, they say, perpetuates a cycle of sexism in the industry. Jade, for instance, argued it was hypocritical for the Academy to promote greater diversity (including gender diversity) at the same time as nominating Affleck. Wu wrote, &#8220;He&rsquo;s running for an award that honors a craft whose purpose is examining the dignity of the human experience &amp; young women are deeply human&#8221; and then went on to suggest that the clout of the Affleck family has kept some silent in Hollywood. (Actor Matt Damon produced Manchester by the Sea.) She tweeted, &#8220;I&#8217;ve been counseled not to talk about this for career&#8217;s sake. F my career then, I&#8217;m a woman &amp; human first. That&#8217;s what my craft is built on.&#8221; Affleck seemed to address the controversy at the Golden Globes. During his acceptance speech, Affleck alluded to the &#8220;noise&#8221; that comes with fame, which some interpreted as a reference to the lawsuits and the press surrounding them. &ldquo;Despite how I might think I&rsquo;m in charge at my house, it&rsquo;s my kids who give me permission to do this because they have got the strength of character to keep at bay all the noise that sometimes surrounds people who live publicly,&rdquo; he said. (A few outlets also noted that actress Brie Larson, who presented Affleck with his award at the Globes, did not hug him or shake his hand as is customary.) The case has drawn comparisons to other high-profile scandals in Hollywood. The Academy has a long history with nominees who have been accused of misconduct. Roman Polanski fled the country after he was arrested for and pled guilty to the rape of a 13-year-old girl and has since won an Oscar. Woody Allen has been accused of sexually abusing his adopted daughter but has been honored by the Oscars. Many have argued that Affleck&#8217;s nomination is just the latest example of the Academy&#8217;s longstanding tradition of ignoring harassment allegations. This argument was bolstered by this year&#8217;s surprise nomination of Mel Gibson, who was caught on tape in a drunken anti-Semitic rant in 2006 and later pled no contest to misdemeanor battery in 2011 for hitting his ex-girlfriend repeatedly in the face."},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003ECasey Affleck has won over a dozen awards, including a Golden Globe, for his performance in Manchester by the Sea, and with Tuesday&#8217;s nominations he became a favorite to win the best actor Oscar in February. Though expected, the news has elicited objections from actors, activists and commentators on the grounds the Academy disregarded sexual&hellip;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n"},"author":25471172,"featured_media":4628615,"comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"format":"standard","categories":[1],"tags":[6758],"time_section":[1098],"money_section":[],"time_topic":[],"primary_time_section":[430937767],"primary_money_section":[],"primary_time_topic":[],"paid":false,"display_modified_time":false,"_links":{"fortune:featured":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4645846\u002Ffeatured"}],"fortune:primary_tag":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4645846\u002Fprimary_tag"}],"fortune:primary_section":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4645846\u002Fprimary_section"}]},"_embedded":{"fortune:featured":[{"size":"landscape","type":"image","visible":true,"image":{"id":4628615,"link":"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F01\u002Fgettyimages-631272414.jpg?quality=85","alt":"74th Annual Golden Globe Awards - Press Room","caption":"Casey Affleck poses in the press room during the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. A new study from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention found that 25% of overdose deaths are from heroin, which is three times the proportion in 1999 (8%). Overall, the age-adjusted rate of drug overdose deaths in 2015 at 16.3 per 100,000 was more than 2.5 times the rate in 1999, when it was 6.1 per 100,000. Adults between the ages of 45 and 54 had the highest rates of overdose deaths in 2015, and the rates are increasing among non-Hispanic white people, nearly 3.5 times the rate in 1999, according to the CDC. Read TIME&#8217;s cover story: Why America Can&rsquo;t Kick Its Painkiller Problem Researchers acknowledged that several factors could affect death rate measurement, including but not limited to the fact that drug overdose deaths can involve multiple drugs. Heroin, however, has been a growing concern in the U.S. The CDC noted in 2015 that heroin use has increased among both men and women across most age ages and income level."},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EThree times the proportion in more","parent":0,"count":5888,"filter":"raw","all_sections":["health"]}]}},{"id":4676496,"date":"2017-02-23T11:50:46","date_gmt":"2017-02-23T16:50:46","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F?page_id=4676496"},"modified":"2017-02-23T11:49:52","modified_gmt":"2017-02-23T16:49:52","slug":"philippines-rodrigo-duterte-drug-war-local-photographers","type":"page","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fphilippines-rodrigo-duterte-drug-war-local-photographers\u002F","title":{"rendered":"'I Am Seeing My Countrymen Die'"},"content":{"rendered":"\u003Cp style=\"text-align:center;\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-family:Georgia, serif;color:#808080;font-size:35px;letter-spacing:0;line-height:100%;\"\u003ELocal photographers on the frontline of Duterte&#8217;s drug war reflect on the images that moved them most\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align:center;text-transform:uppercase;font-size:15px;margin-top:-20px;letter-spacing:.125em;font-family:franklin-gothic-urw, sans-serif;\"\u003EBy \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fauthor\u002Fandrew-katz\"style=\"text-decoration:none;color:white;\"  target=\"_new\"\u003EAndrew Katz\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EA teenage &#8220;John Doe&#8221; lies on a mortuary table, dead from multiple gunshot wounds. A woman cradles her partner under the harsh light of television cameras, beside a piece of cardboard that labels him a &ldquo;pusher.&rdquo; A sister, far from home, uses video-calling on her smartphone to mourn with relatives during the funeral of her brother.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThese scenes and more have become commonplace across the Philippines over the last eight months of President Rodrigo Duterte&rsquo;s \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4495896\u002Fphilippine-president-rodrigo-duterte\u002F\"style=\"text-decoration:none;color:#808080;\" \u003Edeadly crusade\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. More than 7,000 suspected drug users, dealers and innocents have been \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.rappler.com\u002Fnewsbreak\u002Fiq\u002F145814-numbers-statistics-philippines-war-drugs\"style=\"text-decoration:none;color:#808080;\"  target=\"_blank\"\u003Ereported\u003C\u002Fa\u003E slain by unidentified vigilantes or during confrontations with police. It was only after the high-profile killing of a South Korean businessman at police headquarters&mdash;an embarrassment for Duterte&mdash;that the president said the police&#8217;s anti-drug units would be dissolved. Still, he pledged to continue the campaign.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAs the body count has risen, so has the number of photographers who have seen the streets stained by blood. The killings have drawn in veteran foreign photographers like TIME&#8217;s \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fphilippines-drug-war\u002F\"style=\"text-decoration:none;color:#808080;\" \u003EJames Nachtwey\u003C\u002Fa\u003E and Daniel Berehulak, whose \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.nytimes.com\u002Finteractive\u002F2016\u002F12\u002F07\u002Fworld\u002Fasia\u002Frodrigo-duterte-philippines-drugs-killings.html\"style=\"text-decoration:none;color:#808080;\"  target=\"_blank\"\u003Einvestigation\u003C\u002Fa\u003E for the New York \u003Cem\u003ETimes\u003C\u002Fem\u003E recently earned a George Polk Award. But it is a strong group of local photographers&mdash;comprised of freelancers and those working for the wires&mdash;who have committed to keeping the human toll in the public eye. They live in this hell, waiting for the next lead to the next crime scene.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ETIME asked 12 of them to select an image from their archives and in their own words, which have been lightly edited for brevity and clarity, explain the scene and its personal significance. Individually, each image represents a unique moment when humanity has been tested. Together, they align statistics with faces and names&mdash;making justice a little harder to avoid, whenever dawn comes.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align:center;\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWarning: Some of the following images are graphic in nature and might be disturbing to some viewers\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align:center;margin-top:50px;margin-bottom:20px;\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-family:franklin-gothic-urw, Helvetica, Arial sans-serif;color:#808080;font-size:23px;letter-spacing:.25em;line-height:80%;font-weight:800;text-transform:uppercase;-webkit-font-smoothing:antialiased;margin:10px 0;text-decoration:none;\"\u003ECarlo Gabuco\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cfigure class=\"inline-special_bleed aligncenter \"\u003E\u003Cimg data-attachment-id=\"4676435\" data-permalink=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fphilippines-rodrigo-duterte-drug-war-local-photographers\u002Fcarlo-gabuco-philippines-drug-war\u002F\" data-orig-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Fcarlo-gabuco-philippines-drug-war.jpg?quality=85\" data-orig-size=\"2560,1709\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta='{\"aperture\":\"0\",\"credit\":\"\",\"camera\":\"\",\"caption\":\"\",\"created_timestamp\":\"0\",\"copyright\":\"C.Gabuco\",\"focal_length\":\"0\",\"iso\":\"0\",\"shutter_speed\":\"0\",\"title\":\"\",\"orientation\":\"0\"}' data-image-title=\"carlo-gabuco-philippines-drug-war\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Fcarlo-gabuco-philippines-drug-war.jpg?quality=85&w=300\" data-large-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Fcarlo-gabuco-philippines-drug-war.jpg?quality=85&w=600\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Fcarlo-gabuco-philippines-drug-war.jpg?w=1200&#038;quality=85&#038;h=801\" alt=\"Carlo Gabuco\" height=\"801\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigcaption class=\"image-caption\" \u003E\u003Cspan class=\"credit\" \u003ECarlo Gabuco\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIt was the eve of Halloween when five people were killed inside one small house in Mandaluyong City, a poor community east of Manila. It was an intense night for everyone, including me.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ERelatives of the victims were hysterical and emotional. I took this photo because, to me, this is the only time a family was able to grieve&mdash;even for just a brief moment. Afterward comes the worries about where to get the money to pay for an autopsy and funeral service.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThere&#8217;s always a moment of disbelief whenever we go to a crime scene and see the victim for the first time, see how they suffered at the hands of their killers. It all changes whenever a family member arrives. I don&#8217;t know if it&#8217;s the right way to do it, but I always put myself in their position: trying to imagine what they are going through in that particular moment, seeing a loved one die a horrific death. It&#8217;s still hard for me to comprehend the level of grief and anger they must feel.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThis photo represents how horrible this so-called &#8220;drug war&#8221; is, and what it does to a family left behind. I always wonder how&mdash;scarred by the experience&mdash;this will affect the children when they grow up, how this will affect the whole society.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align:center;margin-top:50px;margin-bottom:20px;\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-family:franklin-gothic-urw, Helvetica, Arial sans-serif;color:#808080;font-size:23px;letter-spacing:.25em;line-height:80%;font-weight:800;text-transform:uppercase;-webkit-font-smoothing:antialiased;margin:10px 0;text-decoration:none;\"\u003ERaffy Lerma\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cfigure class=\"inline-special_bleed aligncenter \"\u003E\u003Cimg data-attachment-id=\"4676443\" data-permalink=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fphilippines-rodrigo-duterte-drug-war-local-photographers\u002Fraffy-lerma-philippines-drug-war\u002F\" data-orig-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Fraffy-lerma-philippines-drug-war.jpg?quality=85\" data-orig-size=\"2560,1858\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta='{\"aperture\":\"0\",\"credit\":\"\",\"camera\":\"\",\"caption\":\"\",\"created_timestamp\":\"0\",\"copyright\":\"\",\"focal_length\":\"0\",\"iso\":\"0\",\"shutter_speed\":\"0\",\"title\":\"\",\"orientation\":\"0\"}' data-image-title=\"raffy-lerma-philippines-drug-war\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Fraffy-lerma-philippines-drug-war.jpg?quality=85&w=300\" data-large-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Fraffy-lerma-philippines-drug-war.jpg?quality=85&w=600\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Fraffy-lerma-philippines-drug-war.jpg?w=1200&#038;quality=85&#038;h=871\" alt=\"Raffy Lerma&acirc;&#128;&#148;Philippine Daily Inquirer\" height=\"871\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigcaption class=\"image-caption\" \u003E\u003Cspan class=\"credit\" \u003ERaffy Lerma&mdash;Philippine Daily Inquirer\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIt was a humid July night, and Manila&rsquo;s graveyard shift journalists had just responded to yet another police call about an alleged drug addict shot to death by vigilantes responding to President Duterte&rsquo;s call to clean the streets of crime.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EI knew this night was different. A police cordon blocked off journalists and bystanders, as Jennilyn Olayres grieved over the lifeless body of her partner Michael Siaron. The murderers left a sign that read &ldquo;I am a drug pusher, do not copy,&rdquo; as a crowd, mostly composed of Manila castaways, mingled. According to witnesses, they saw a gunman on a motorcycle driven by an accomplice shoot Siaron. Another person was wounded in the attack. T.V. floodlights and news cameras popped and flashed as the macabre scene played out in front of me.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAs a news photographer it was my job to document what was happening, but a part of me that heard Olayres&rsquo;s pleas for help also died a little. It was raw and gut-wrenching, but I could do nothing but press the shutter button. &ldquo;That&rsquo;s enough! And help us!&rdquo; she cried out to media workers, authorities and onlookers.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&ldquo;What are you waiting for?,&rdquo; I asked a policeman, who shrugged before bluntly retorting: &ldquo;We can&rsquo;t do anything as he is already dead.&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ECrime scene investigators subsequently arrived. To them, Siaron was just another body to be processed. It was the third extrajudicial killing I had photographed that night, and would \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4436655\u002Frodrigo-duterte-philippines-drug-newspaper\u002F\"style=\"text-decoration:none;color:#808080;\" \u003Eland on the front page\u003C\u002Fa\u003E of the nation&rsquo;s leading newspaper, the \u003Cem\u003EPhilippine Daily Inquirer\u003C\u002Fem\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe area where the killings occurred earned the moniker &ldquo;Patay City,&rdquo; or the dead city, a play on its real name, Pasay City. A report about the night&rsquo;s fourth body, slain in the same general area, came shortly after. Many of my colleagues and I hurried off, but we all had a heavy heart.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align:center;margin-top:50px;margin-bottom:20px;\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-family:franklin-gothic-urw, Helvetica, Arial sans-serif;color:#808080;font-size:23px;letter-spacing:.25em;line-height:80%;font-weight:800;text-transform:uppercase;-webkit-font-smoothing:antialiased;margin:10px 0;text-decoration:none;\"\u003EAlecs Ongcal\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cfigure class=\"inline-special_bleed aligncenter \"\u003E\u003Cimg data-attachment-id=\"4676502\" data-permalink=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fphilippines-rodrigo-duterte-drug-war-local-photographers\u002Falecs-ongcal-philippines-drug-war\u002F\" data-orig-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Falecs-ongcal-philippines-drug-war.jpg?quality=85\" data-orig-size=\"2560,1709\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta='{\"aperture\":\"0\",\"credit\":\"\",\"camera\":\"\",\"caption\":\"\",\"created_timestamp\":\"0\",\"copyright\":\"Photo by Alecs Ongcal\",\"focal_length\":\"0\",\"iso\":\"0\",\"shutter_speed\":\"0\",\"title\":\"\",\"orientation\":\"0\"}' data-image-title=\"alecs-ongcal-philippines-drug-war\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Falecs-ongcal-philippines-drug-war.jpg?quality=85&w=300\" data-large-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Falecs-ongcal-philippines-drug-war.jpg?quality=85&w=600\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Falecs-ongcal-philippines-drug-war.jpg?w=1200&#038;quality=85&#038;h=801\" alt=\"Alecs Ongcal\" height=\"801\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigcaption class=\"image-caption\" \u003E\u003Cspan class=\"credit\" \u003EAlecs Ongcal\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe night shift usually starts at 10 p.m. Cars fill the parking lot and journalists gather at the press corps in the Manila Police District, the main headquarters of the city cops. By then, I need to make sure all my homework and reading is done. I am still a full-time undergraduate student, but taking photos as freelancer. As President Duterte promised, change did come when the war on drugs started.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ENow, my nights are spent waiting for phone calls not from my friends, but from homicide investigators. The flashing lights I see aren&rsquo;t from parties, but from police sirens. And I hear the cries of grieving mothers more than the voice of own my mom.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EOn a full night we get an average of eight bodies. This photograph was taken after I left a fast food restaurant in Pasay City, close to midnight on Nov. 17. We see the same grief that families cry, the same look on the faces of bystanders and the same script of police answers during interviews. The only thing different are the faces of the dead, but sometimes they start to look the same as well.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EMurder has became a norm and lives are as disposable as the cardboard signs that vigilantes use to label the bodies of suspected criminals. When the night shift ends, I take a nap and then rush to my first class in the morning. Sometimes, I even forget to change my shirt.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EWe talk about the issues in class but forget about them when the bell rings. If they only knew that the screams and cries that I hear at night are louder than that bell. If they only knew they&rsquo;re walking on the pavement stained with the blood of the man stabbed 10 times last night. If they only knew the bench they&rsquo;re sitting on is the exact bench the children stood on as they watched the body of their father being carried to the funeral ambulance.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIf they only knew, while we spend another day in class, how the life of a family drastically changes forever. But it&rsquo;s difficult, since the war on drugs hasn&rsquo;t reached many of us yet.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align:center;margin-top:50px;margin-bottom:20px;\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-family:franklin-gothic-urw, Helvetica, Arial sans-serif;color:#808080;font-size:23px;letter-spacing:.25em;line-height:80%;font-weight:800;text-transform:uppercase;-webkit-font-smoothing:antialiased;margin:10px 0;text-decoration:none;\"\u003EBasilio H. Sepe\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cfigure class=\"inline-special_bleed aligncenter \"\u003E\u003Cimg data-attachment-id=\"4676441\" data-permalink=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fphilippines-rodrigo-duterte-drug-war-local-photographers\u002Feli-sepe-philippines-drug-war\u002F\" data-orig-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Feli-sepe-philippines-drug-war.jpg?quality=85\" data-orig-size=\"2560,1707\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta='{\"aperture\":\"0\",\"credit\":\"\",\"camera\":\"\",\"caption\":\"\",\"created_timestamp\":\"0\",\"copyright\":\"(c)Fernando G. Sepe, Jr.\",\"focal_length\":\"0\",\"iso\":\"0\",\"shutter_speed\":\"0\",\"title\":\"\",\"orientation\":\"0\"}' data-image-title=\"eli-sepe-philippines-drug-war\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Feli-sepe-philippines-drug-war.jpg?quality=85&w=300\" data-large-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Feli-sepe-philippines-drug-war.jpg?quality=85&w=600\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Feli-sepe-philippines-drug-war.jpg?w=1200&#038;quality=85&#038;h=800\" alt=\"Basilio H. Sepe\" height=\"800\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigcaption class=\"image-caption\" \u003E\u003Cspan class=\"credit\" \u003EBasilio H. Sepe\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EI always admired my countrymen. Not just because of their resiliency as a people, but also how they still appear to be helpful and happy even in times of despair. It is a sight to appreciate and be proud of. But something changed when the so-called war on drugs started. I have been working the night shift for the past several months and have had my fair share of coverage that brings blood and tears. It is saddening and crushing. Situations like these do tend to test the heart. I am seeing my countrymen die even if there is still hope for them to live.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIt was at this wake that I knew something was horribly wrong. This was the first time I reported at a funeral. Ronnel Jaraba, 30, was found lifeless along the C3 Road in Metro Manila on Jan. 26. According to his family, he was a former drug user but stopped when he became a father of two kids. His wake took 11 days to complete due to a lack of money. There were a lot of relatives, all mourning his loss, but my attention was focused on his father, Renato. He said Ronnel was his youngest son of three.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cem\u003EIt can&#8217;t be my child. It can&#8217;t be!\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EHe cried, screaming along with the other relatives, and had to be ushered away by his friends so he could calm down. I didn&#8217;t realize I was crying while I was taking my shots. It came to a point that even I couldn&#8217;t take it anymore. I lowered the camera, went to a secluded place and cried.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EBefore I left the cemetery, I saw Renato once more. He was calmer, more collected, but I still saw the grief in his eyes. I thanked him before I left and offered my prayers. All the while I was hoping, praying, that these events would stop. It was at this moment that I realized that, as a journalist, it is moments like these that I question my humanity and the reality around me. I cannot be unaffected.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align:center;margin-top:50px;margin-bottom:20px;\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-family:franklin-gothic-urw, Helvetica, Arial sans-serif;color:#808080;font-size:23px;letter-spacing:.25em;line-height:80%;font-weight:800;text-transform:uppercase;-webkit-font-smoothing:antialiased;margin:10px 0;text-decoration:none;\"\u003EVincent Go\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cfigure class=\"inline-special_bleed aligncenter \"\u003E\u003Cimg data-attachment-id=\"4676444\" data-permalink=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fphilippines-rodrigo-duterte-drug-war-local-photographers\u002Fvincent-go-philippines-drug-war\u002F\" data-orig-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Fvincent-go-philippines-drug-war.jpg?quality=85\" data-orig-size=\"2560,1707\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta='{\"aperture\":\"0\",\"credit\":\"\",\"camera\":\"\",\"caption\":\"\",\"created_timestamp\":\"0\",\"copyright\":\"Vincent Go\",\"focal_length\":\"0\",\"iso\":\"0\",\"shutter_speed\":\"0\",\"title\":\"\",\"orientation\":\"0\"}' data-image-title=\"vincent-go-philippines-drug-war\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Fvincent-go-philippines-drug-war.jpg?quality=85&w=300\" data-large-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Fvincent-go-philippines-drug-war.jpg?quality=85&w=600\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Fvincent-go-philippines-drug-war.jpg?w=1200&#038;quality=85&#038;h=800\" alt=\"Vincent Go\" height=\"800\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigcaption class=\"image-caption\" \u003E\u003Cspan class=\"credit\" \u003EVincent Go\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EEstimated to be about 15 years old, this boy on a mortuary table in September 2016 is another life lost among the thousands killed in the government&#8217;s campaign against illegal narcotics. Witnesses say he ran when the police came to their slum community in Tondo, a district in Manila, and that police opened fire.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EHe survived the volley of bullets but died on the operating table a few hours later. Nobody came to the hospital to claim and identify the boy.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ETo me, he represents the thousands who have been killed. He came from the poor sector, maybe with no or little education. He was faceless, voiceless and would not complain of his rights when being violated.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EHe is just another statistic, another number, another accomplishment report for authorities that claim to be just doing their job.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align:center;margin-top:50px;margin-bottom:20px;\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-family:franklin-gothic-urw, Helvetica, Arial sans-serif;color:#808080;font-size:23px;letter-spacing:.25em;line-height:80%;font-weight:800;text-transform:uppercase;-webkit-font-smoothing:antialiased;margin:10px 0;text-decoration:none;\"\u003EHannah Reyes Morales\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cfigure class=\"inline-special_bleed aligncenter \"\u003E\u003Cimg data-attachment-id=\"4676438\" data-permalink=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fphilippines-rodrigo-duterte-drug-war-local-photographers\u002Fhannah-reyes-morales-philippines-drug-war\u002F\"
