In some cases, as with sisters Olivia de Havilland and Joan Fontaine&mdash;the only pair of siblings to win lead acting Oscars&mdash;sibling rivalry hung like a dark cloud over family bonds. Other Hollywood siblings have utilized their relationship towards more constructive ends, like the Coen Brothers, who share Oscars for Fargo and No Country for Old Men. And at this Sunday&#8217;s Oscars, a Best Actor win for Casey Affleck would add him and older brother Ben, who has two little gold men already, to the esteemed list. With the ceremony fast approaching, TIME looks back at the famous&mdash;and not-so-famous&mdash;Academy Award-winning siblings."},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003ESince the dawn of movie-making, Hollywood has seen a number of talented dynasties: the Coppolas, the Barrymores, the Fondas. In some cases, as with sisters Olivia de Havilland and Joan Fontaine&mdash;the only pair of siblings to win lead acting Oscars&mdash;sibling rivalry hung like a dark cloud over family bonds. Other Hollywood siblings have utilized their&hellip;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n"},"author":96374700,"featured_media":4679802,"comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"format":"standard","categories":[1],"tags":[420934628,190,56926,430943132],"time_section":[1098],"money_section":[],"time_topic":[],"primary_time_section":[430937767],"primary_money_section":[],"primary_time_topic":[],"paid":false,"display_modified_time":false,"_links":{"self":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4679006"}],"collection":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts"}],"author":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4679006\u002Fauthor"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4679006\u002Ffeaturedmedia"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fcategories?post=4679006"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags?post=4679006"},{"taxonomy":"topic","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftopics?post=4679006"}],"wp:meta":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4679006\u002Fmeta"}],"wp:attachment":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4679006\u002Fmedia"}],"fortune:featured":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4679006\u002Ffeatured"}],"fortune:related":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4679006\u002Frelated"}],"fortune:authors":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4679006\u002Fauthors"}],"fo How Many Oscars \u003Ci\u003ELa La Land\u003C\u002Fi\u003E Is Likely to Win"},"content":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EWhen it comes to the \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4673701\u002Foscars-2017-what-to-know\u002F\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EOscars\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E, the question whirling in the rarefied air surrounding \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003ELa La Land\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E is not \u003Cem\u003Ewhether\u003C\u002Fem\u003E but \u003Cem\u003Ehow many\u003C\u002Fem\u003E. After a \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4622027\u002Fgolden-globes-2017-winners\u002F\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EGolden Globes\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E outing worthy of its own gushing musical number, the cinematic ode to Hollywood has traveled what seems to be an anointed path toward golden-man glory. But what are the movie&rsquo;s chances at taking all of the 14 awards for which it was nominated, and where does that situate it in Oscar history? Here&rsquo;s the rundown on its prospects for victory on Sunday, Feb. 26.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003EWhat records has it already set? \u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003ELa La Land \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Ehas tied the record for most nominations&mdash;\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E14&mdash;putting it in the company of just two movies, \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EAll About Eve \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Eand \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003ETitanic\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E. This is out of a total of 24 categories, though keep in mind that a film can&rsquo;t possibly be nominated for all of them: three awards recognize short films, and though nominees for Best Documentary, Animated Feature and Foreign Film can be nominated for awards like Best Picture, it happens infrequently (see: \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EBeauty and the Beast\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E, \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EUp\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E, \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003ECrouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E).\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EMORE\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4673744\u002Foscars-2017-how-to-watch\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EHere&#8217;s How You Can Watch the 2017 Oscars\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003EWhat records could it set? \u003C\u002Fb\u003EIf \u003Ci\u003ELa La Land \u003C\u002Fi\u003Ewins at least 12 awards, it will boast the most wins ever. If it wins 11, it will share the record with \u003Ci\u003ETitanic\u003C\u002Fi\u003E, \u003Ci\u003EBen-Hur \u003C\u002Fi\u003Eand \u003Ci\u003EThe Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King\u003C\u002Fi\u003E. If it wins 10, it will tie \u003Ci\u003EWest Side Story \u003C\u002Fi\u003Efor most Oscars won by a musical. And if Damien Chazelle wins for Best Director, he will tie for the youngest winner in that field&mdash;the record is currently held by Norman Taurog, who was 32 when he won in 1932 for the comedy \u003Ci\u003ESkippy\u003C\u002Fi\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003ECan it achieve a sweep? \u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EIt&rsquo;s almost impossible for \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003ELa La Land \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Eto sweep, which occurs when a film wins every award for which it was nominated. The record for the biggest sweep was set in 2004, when \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EThe Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E was nominated for and won 11 Oscars. But two of \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003ELa La Land\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E&rsquo;s nominations are in the same category&mdash;Best Original Song&mdash;and though there have been a handful of \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fmentalfloss.com\u002Farticle\u002F61734\u002F6-times-there-were-ties-oscars\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Eties in Oscar history\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E, this one is pretty unlikely, putting the movie&rsquo;s likely maximum take at 13.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EMORE\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4675741\u002Foscars-2017-almost-egot-lin-manuel-miranda\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E31 Artists You Didn&rsquo;t Know Are Super Close to an EGOT\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003E\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Cb\u003EHow many awards is it actually likely to win? \u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003ELa La Land \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Eis likely to max out at 10 Oscars, though upsets in a few categories could spread the love a little more and reduce the final number. Though it looks to have Best Picture, Best Actress and Best Director on lock, it&#8217;s more vulnerable in other categories. Let&rsquo;s subtract from its maximum of 13, category by category: Ryan Gosling is unlikely to win Best Actor, as Casey Affleck has long been the frontrunner in that category, with Denzel Washington close behind, bringing us down to 12. \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EManchester by the Sea\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E&rsquo;s Kenneth Lonergan has the edge in the Original Screenplay category, one in which musicals have historically fared poorly. Now we&rsquo;re at 11. It&rsquo;s also vulnerable in the Sound Editing category, where \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EHacksaw Ridge \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Eis dominant, bringing its likely take down to 10. \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EOf course, anything is possible&mdash;\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EMoonlight \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Eor Barry Jenkins could pull out a Best Picture or Best Director surprise, or \u003Cem\u003ELa La Land\u003C\u002Fem\u003E&#8216;s nominated songs could split the vote, allowing \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EMoana\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E&rsquo;s &ldquo;How Far I&rsquo;ll Go&rdquo; to go farther than expected. But whatever the final tally, \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003ELa La Land \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Eis certain to collect some serious bling Sunday night. The &ldquo;\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.youtube.com\u002Fwatch?v=GTWqwSNQCcg\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003ECity of Stars\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E&rdquo; may not be shining \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Ejust\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E for you, Ryan and Emma, but it shines, at the very least, \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Emostly \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Efor you\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["When it comes to the ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4673701\u002Foscars-2017-what-to-know\u002F"},"content":["Oscars"]},", the question whirling in the rarefied air surrounding ",{"tag":"i","attributes":[],"content":["La La Land"]}," is not ",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["whether"]}," but ",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["how many"]},". "]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Of course, anything is possible",{"tag":"i","attributes":[],"content":["Moonlight "]},"or Barry Jenkins could pull out a Best Picture or Best Director surprise, or ",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["La La Land"]},"'s nominated songs could split the vote, allowing ",{"tag":"i","attributes":[],"content":["Moana"]},"s How Far Ill Go to go farther than expected. But whatever the final tally, ",{"tag":"i","attributes":[],"content":["La La Land "]},"is certain to collect some serious bling Sunday night. The ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.youtube.com\u002Fwatch?v=GTWqwSNQCcg"},"content":["City of Stars"]}," may not be shining ",{"tag":"i","attributes":[],"content":["just"]}," for you, Ryan and Emma, but it shines, at the very least, ",{"tag":"i","attributes":[],"content":["mostly "]},"for you ."]}],"plain":"When it comes to the Oscars, the question whirling in the rarefied air surrounding La La Land is not whether but how many. After a Golden Globes outing worthy of its own gushing musical number, the cinematic ode to Hollywood has traveled what seems to be an anointed path toward golden-man glory. But what are the movie&rsquo;s chances at taking all of the 14 awards for which it was nominated, and where does that situate it in Oscar history? Here&rsquo;s the rundown on its prospects for victory on Sunday, Feb. 26. What records has it already set? La La Land has tied the record for most nominations&mdash;14&mdash;putting it in the company of just two movies, All About Eve and Titanic. This is out of a total of 24 categories, though keep in mind that a film can&rsquo;t possibly be nominated for all of them: three awards recognize short films, and though nominees for Best Documentary, Animated Feature and Foreign Film can be nominated for awards like Best Picture, it happens infrequently (see: Beauty and the Beast, Up, Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon). MORE Here&#8217;s How You Can Watch the 2017 Oscars What records could it set? If La La Land wins at least 12 awards, it will boast the most wins ever. If it wins 11, it will share the record with Titanic, Ben-Hur and The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King. If it wins 10, it will tie West Side Story for most Oscars won by a musical. And if Damien Chazelle wins for Best Director, he will tie for the youngest winner in that field&mdash;the record is currently held by Norman Taurog, who was 32 when he won in 1932 for the comedy Skippy. Can it achieve a sweep? It&rsquo;s almost impossible for La La Land to sweep, which occurs when a film wins every award for which it was nominated. The record for the biggest sweep was set in 2004, when The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King was nominated for and won 11 Oscars. But two of La La Land&rsquo;s nominations are in the same category&mdash;Best Original Song&mdash;and though there have been a handful of ties in Oscar history, this one is pretty unlikely, putting the movie&rsquo;s likely maximum take at 13. MORE 31 Artists You Didn&rsquo;t Know Are Super Close to an EGOT How many awards is it actually likely to win? La La Land is likely to max out at 10 Oscars, though upsets in a few categories could spread the love a little more and reduce the final number. Though it looks to have Best Picture, Best Actress and Best Director on lock, it&#8217;s more vulnerable in other categories. Let&rsquo;s subtract from its maximum of 13, category by category: Ryan Gosling is unlikely to win Best Actor, as Casey Affleck has long been the frontrunner in that category, with Denzel Washington close behind, bringing us down to 12. Manchester by the Sea&rsquo;s Kenneth Lonergan has the edge in the Original Screenplay category, one in which musicals have historically fared poorly. Now we&rsquo;re at 11. It&rsquo;s also vulnerable in the Sound Editing category, where Hacksaw Ridge is dominant, bringing its likely take down to 10. Of course, anything is possible&mdash;Moonlight or Barry Jenkins could pull out a Best Picture or Best Director surprise, or La La Land&#8216;s nominated songs could split the vote, allowing Moana&rsquo;s &ldquo;How Far I&rsquo;ll Go&rdquo; to go farther than expected. But whatever the final tally, La La Land is certain to collect some serious bling Sunday night. The &ldquo;City of Stars&rdquo; may not be shining just for you, Ryan and Emma, but it shines, at the very least, mostly for you."},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EWhen it comes to the Oscars, the question whirling in the rarefied air surrounding La La Land is not whether but how many. The film and its visuals developed from a deep collaboration with his college friend, screenwriter and director Barry Jenkins, that date back to when they met 17 years ago at Florida State University. Since that time the duo developed a very personal aesthetic their work inspired by fine art photography and indie cinema. Laxton, who says he first started talking about this movie with Jenkins years ago, breaks down the anatomy of the film&#8217;s pivotal scenes and reveals the who inspired the distinct look of Moonlight. href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4575255\u002Fmanchester-by-the-sea-movie-review\u002F?iid=sr-link1\"\u003EManchester by the Sea\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, \u003C\u002Fem\u003Ebecause Seth Meyers just resist&mdash;\u003Cem\u003EOscar Bait\u003C\u002Fem\u003E, the film that, at least according to the trailer, the \u003Cem\u003ELos Angeles Times \u003C\u002Fem\u003Ecalled, &ldquo;The most blatant On Late Night, Meyers unveiled a new movie that Academy voters simply won&rsquo;t be able to resist&mdash;Oscar Bait, the film that, at least according to the trailer, the Los Angeles Times called, &ldquo;The most blatant attempt to win an Oscar since The King&rsquo;s Speech.&rdquo; The tear-jerking movie stars Meyers as a seemingly tragic figure intent on staring intensely into the distance, making dramatic eye contact with a small child, and deeply contemplating lost opportunities in his past. As the trailer points out, the film has everything that Oscar voters typically prize from racial tension to &ldquo;pretentiously artist shots of a man&rsquo;s hand grazing wheat&rdquo; to a rare disease that must be overcome. Perhaps most importantly, the film features a man staring at trains. What Oscar voter could resist? Things Jimmy Kimmel Will Probably Do at the Oscars"},"content":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EWhen \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4590669\u002Fjimmy-kimmel-oscars-academy-awards-host\u002F\"\u003EJimmy Kimmel\u003C\u002Fa\u003E takes the stage to host \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4673701\u002Foscars-2017-what-to-know\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Ethe 89th Academy Awards\u003C\u002Fa\u003E Feb. 26, there will be quite a few \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4644540\u002Foscar-nominations-2017-snubs-surprises\u002F\"\u003Esurprises\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. No one knows for sure which movie will win \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4586185\u002Foscar-awards-guide\u002F\"\u003EBest Picture\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, who will give the best (and worst) acceptance speech or what \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4240790\u002Foscars-chris-rock-joe-biden-cookies\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Enovelty snack\u003C\u002Fa\u003E the audience \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F11337\u002Freview-pizza-night-at-ellen-degeneres-2014-oscars\u002F\"\u003Ewill get\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. But Kimmel has a penchant for certain bits, so based on his history, a few things seem pretty much guaranteed to happen.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EWhether it&#8217;s during the live Oscars broadcast itself or an episode of \u003Cem\u003EJimmy Kimmel Live!\u003C\u002Fem\u003E before or after the show, there&#8217;s a good chance the late night host will have several of his usual tricks up his sleeve.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EHere are five TIME predictions on what Kimmel will probably do for Hollywood&#8217;s biggest night of the year.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E1. The feud with Matt Damon will continue.\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIt wouldn&#8217;t be a Kimmel-hosted awards show without a nod to his longest running and arguably best gag of all time: a heated (totally fake) feud with Damon originally inspired by a throwaway joke during a 2005 episode of \u003Cem\u003ELive!\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EKimmel has seemingly already begun hyping this bit, saying that his \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4638415\u002Foscars-2017-jimmy-kimmel-hopes-matt-damon-loses\u002F\"\u003Eonly wish for the show\u003C\u002Fa\u003E is for Damon &mdash; who is nominated for his work as a producer on Best Picture contender \u003Cem\u003EManchester by the Sea \u003C\u002Fem\u003E&mdash; to lose. The pair also has a history of playing up their rivalry the night of a big awards show, including the 2010 and 2016 Oscars and the 2016 Emmys. Refresh your memory on the \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4473441\u002Fjimmy-kimmel-matt-damon-feud-history-timeline\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Efeud&#8217;s history here\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article-video\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"time-embed time-embed__youtube video-wrapper\" data-provider=\"youtube\" data-url=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.youtube.com\u002Fwatch?v=MyGJXLxtVEo\" \u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"embed-youtube\"\u003E\u003Ciframe width=\"500\" height=\"281\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.youtube.com\u002Fembed\u002FMyGJXLxtVEo?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen\u003E\u003C\u002Fiframe\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"hulu-video-wrapper\"\u003E\u003Ciframe src=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.hulu.com\u002Fembed.html?eid=3oQl4ZRdr-clbRY5L6G1Lg&#038;partner=time.com\" width=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"\" mozallowfullscreen=\"\" allowfullscreen=\"\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fiframe\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"hulu-video-wrapper\"\u003E\u003Ciframe src=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.hulu.com\u002Fembed.html?eid=9mNPoMsY-kAcZd_A3M5iAQ&#038;partner=time.com\" width=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"\" mozallowfullscreen=\"\" allowfullscreen=\"\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fiframe\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E2. There will be mention of a certain president.\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIf the Golden Globes and SAG Awards were any indication of how \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4652984\u002Fscreen-actors-guild-awards-2017-the-best-worst-and-most-political-moments\u002F\"\u003Epolitically-charged\u003C\u002Fa\u003E the 2017 awards season is going to be, then the Oscars are sure to be a wild ride. Kimmel has made his views on President Donald Trump pretty clear, frequently poking fun at the President on \u003Cem\u003ELive!\u003C\u002Fem\u003E He even cracked a number of jokes about Trump when he hosted the pre-election \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4498696\u002Femmys-2016-jimmy-kimmel-mark-burnett-donald-trump\u002F\"\u003E2016 Emmys\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. A few of Kimmel&#8217;s more recent Trump-inspired bits have revolved around the inauguration, the potential U.S.-Mexico border wall and the meaning of &#8220;alternative facts.&#8221; It&#8217;s likely that the Oscars will be no exception.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"hulu-video-wrapper\"\u003E\u003Ciframe src=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.hulu.com\u002Fembed.html?eid=xFAxrNXmCnOJy3oNVvIo2g&#038;partner=time.com\" width=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"\" mozallowfullscreen=\"\" allowfullscreen=\"\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fiframe\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"hulu-video-wrapper\"\u003E\u003Ciframe src=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.hulu.com\u002Fembed.html?eid=fNYQE8jX0a_qlhz4NXFFyQ&#038;partner=time.com\" width=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"\" mozallowfullscreen=\"\" allowfullscreen=\"\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fiframe\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"hulu-video-wrapper\"\u003E\u003Ciframe src=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.hulu.com\u002Fembed.html?eid=BuAfChkYXromKKpezFMfJQ&#038;partner=time.com\" width=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"\" mozallowfullscreen=\"\" allowfullscreen=\"\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fiframe\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E3. The trailer for the third \u003Cem\u003EMovie: The Movie \u003C\u002Fem\u003Ewill make its debut\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EFirst there was \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fnewsfeed.time.com\u002F2012\u002F02\u002F27\u002Fjimmy-kimmel-enlists-oprah-every-other-celebrity-for-post-oscar-special\u002F\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EMovie: The Movie\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, a star-studded trailer that packed in &#8220;everything moviegoers love.&#8221; It didn&#8217;t stop there. Then there was \u003Cem\u003EMovie: The Movie 2V\u003C\u002Fem\u003E. Now, it&#8217;s time for Kimmel to complete the trilogy with an addition for 2017.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article-video\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"time-embed time-embed__youtube video-wrapper\" data-provider=\"youtube\" data-url=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.youtube.com\u002Fwatch?v=w3NwB9PLxss\" \u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"embed-youtube\"\u003E\u003Ciframe width=\"500\" height=\"281\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.youtube.com\u002Fembed\u002Fw3NwB9PLxss?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen\u003E\u003C\u002Fiframe\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article-video\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"time-embed time-embed__youtube video-wrapper\" data-provider=\"youtube\" data-url=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.youtube.com\u002Fwatch?v=ICMOybwDFN0\" \u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"embed-youtube\"\u003E\u003Ciframe width=\"500\" height=\"281\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.youtube.com\u002Fembed\u002FICMOybwDFN0?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen\u003E\u003C\u002Fiframe\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E4. Nominees will read mean tweets about themselves.\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIt&#8217;s hard to imagine Kimmel wouldn&#8217;t take advantage of the opportunity to have this group of A-listers read the hilarious burns written about them on the Internet aloud for the camera. The late night host has previously aired &mdash; among others &mdash; Oscars, Super Bowl and Grammys-themed editions of this sketch. This &#8220;Mean Tweets&#8221; segment would most likely air on an episode of \u003Cem\u003ELive! \u003C\u002Fem\u003Eleading up to the show.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"hulu-video-wrapper\"\u003E\u003Ciframe src=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.hulu.com\u002Fembed.html?eid=0TR-2L27IAn8peVKrIeplg&#038;partner=time.com\" width=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"\" mozallowfullscreen=\"\" allowfullscreen=\"\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fiframe\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"hulu-video-wrapper\"\u003E\u003Ciframe src=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.hulu.com\u002Fembed.html?eid=NEYSOcVB-vuaOO0UtU7zcA&#038;partner=time.com\" width=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"\" mozallowfullscreen=\"\" allowfullscreen=\"\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fiframe\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"hulu-video-wrapper\"\u003E\u003Ciframe src=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.hulu.com\u002Fembed.html?eid=lsX9BM2wUl2m1D_6SDb22A&#038;partner=time.com\" width=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"\" mozallowfullscreen=\"\" allowfullscreen=\"\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fiframe\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E5. The Lie Witness News team will be on the scene.\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ESometimes it seems like there&#8217;s nothing Kimmel enjoys more than sending his \u003Cem\u003ELive! \u003C\u002Fem\u003Eteam out to interview random people on the street about recent stories in the news &mdash; to reveal how way off the responses can be. When asked for their opinions on subjects such as Trump&#8217;s Supreme Court nominee, Obama&#8217;s third term as president and Clinton&#8217;s emails, the interviewees generally offer responses that are both hilarious and cringeworthy, which translates into great television.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EWith the abundance of buzz surrounding this year&#8217;s ceremony, some unsuspecting passerby are almost certainly going to be fielding a Oscars-related questions about movie news that never happened.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"hulu-video-wrapper\"\u003E\u003Ciframe When asked for their opinions on subjects such as Trump's Supreme Court nominee, Obama's third term as president and Clinton's emails, the interviewees generally offer responses that are both hilarious and cringeworthy, which translates into great television."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["With the abundance of buzz surrounding this year's ceremony, some unsuspecting passerby are almost certainly going to be fielding a Oscars-related questions about movie news that never happened."]},{"tag":"oembed","attributes":{"url":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.hulu.com\u002Fembed.html?eid=mpuKVKjoZ5syL9FTfDZ9pQ&amp;partner=time.com","type":"hulu-partner","raw_html":"&lt;iframe src=&quot;http:\u002F\u002Fwww.hulu.com\u002Fembed.html?eid=mpuKVKjoZ5syL9FTfDZ9pQ&amp;partner=time.com&quot;&gt;&lt;\u002Fiframe&gt;"},"content":[]},{"tag":"oembed","attributes":{"url":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.hulu.com\u002Fembed.html?eid=chaa-QeZTrl5kirWLremiw&amp;partner=time.com","type":"hulu-partner","raw_html":"&lt;iframe src=&quot;http:\u002F\u002Fwww.hulu.com\u002Fembed.html?eid=chaa-QeZTrl5kirWLremiw&amp;partner=time.com&quot;&gt;&lt;\u002Fiframe&gt;"},"content":[]},{"tag":"oembed","attributes":{"url":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.hulu.com\u002Fembed.html?eid=uFDlCjLk7EZjL1MQSkTOEw&amp;partner=time.com","type":"hulu-partner","raw_html":"&lt;iframe src=&quot;http:\u002F\u002Fwww.hulu.com\u002Fembed.html?eid=uFDlCjLk7EZjL1MQSkTOEw&amp;partner=time.com&quot;&gt;&lt;\u002Fiframe&gt;"},"content":[]}],"plain":"When Jimmy Kimmel takes the stage to host the 89th Academy Awards Feb. 26, there will be quite a few surprises. No one knows for sure which movie will win Best Picture, who will give the best (and worst) acceptance speech or what novelty snack the audience will get. But Kimmel has a penchant for certain bits, so based on his history, a few things seem pretty much guaranteed to happen. Whether it&#8217;s during the live Oscars broadcast itself or an episode of Jimmy Kimmel Live! before or after the show, there&#8217;s a good chance the late night host will have several of his usual tricks up his sleeve. Here are five TIME predictions on what Kimmel will probably do for Hollywood&#8217;s biggest night of the year. 1. The feud with Matt Damon will continue. It wouldn&#8217;t be a Kimmel-hosted awards show without a nod to his longest running and arguably best gag of all time: a heated (totally fake) feud with Damon originally inspired by a throwaway joke during a 2005 episode of Live! Kimmel has seemingly already begun hyping this bit, saying that his only wish for the show is for Damon &mdash; who is nominated for his work as a producer on Best Picture contender Manchester by the Sea &mdash; to lose. The pair also has a history of playing up their rivalry the night of a big awards show, including the 2010 and 2016 Oscars and the 2016 Emmys. Refresh your memory on the feud&#8217;s history here. &nbsp; &nbsp; 2. There will be mention of a certain president. If the Golden Globes and SAG Awards were any indication of how politically-charged the 2017 awards season is going to be, then the Oscars are sure to be a wild ride. Kimmel has made his views on President Donald Trump pretty clear, frequently poking fun at the President on Live! He even cracked a number of jokes about Trump when he hosted the pre-election 2016 Emmys. A few of Kimmel&#8217;s more recent Trump-inspired bits have revolved around the inauguration, the potential U.S.-Mexico border wall and the meaning of &#8220;alternative facts.&#8221; It&#8217;s likely that the Oscars will be no exception. &nbsp; &nbsp; 3. The trailer for the third Movie: The Movie will make its debut First there was Movie: The Movie, a star-studded trailer that packed in &#8220;everything moviegoers love.&#8221; It didn&#8217;t stop there. Then there was Movie: The Movie 2V. Now, it&#8217;s time for Kimmel to complete the trilogy with an addition for 2017. 4. Nominees will read mean tweets about themselves. It&#8217;s hard to imagine Kimmel wouldn&#8217;t take advantage of the opportunity to have this group of A-listers read the hilarious burns written about them on the Internet aloud for the camera. The late night host has previously aired &mdash; among others &mdash; Oscars, Super Bowl and Grammys-themed editions of this sketch. This &#8220;Mean Tweets&#8221; segment would most likely air on an episode of Live! leading up to the show. &nbsp; &nbsp; 5. The Lie Witness News team will be on the scene. Sometimes it seems like there&#8217;s nothing Kimmel enjoys more than sending his Live! team out to interview random people on the street about recent stories in the news &mdash; to reveal how way off the responses can be. When asked for their opinions on subjects such as Trump&#8217;s Supreme Court nominee, Obama&#8217;s third term as president and Clinton&#8217;s emails, the interviewees generally offer responses that are both hilarious and cringeworthy, which translates into great television. With the abundance of buzz surrounding this year&#8217;s ceremony, some unsuspecting passerby are almost certainly going to be fielding a Oscars-related questions about movie news that never happened. &nbsp; &nbsp;"},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EThe feud with Matt Damon will live MORE Everything You Need to Know About the 2017 Oscars"},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003ELet&rsquo;s start this Oscar predictions party with the concession that to rank wildly different works of art is&mdash;unlike, say, the 100-meter dash&mdash;a rather futile exercise in subjectivity. But as long as the Academy keeps doing it, we&rsquo;ll do it too, because it&rsquo;s fun, and it&rsquo;s the only sport some of us know enough about to&hellip;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n"},"author":73875048,"featured_media":4675463,"comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"format":"standard","categories":[1],"tags":[58298,6758,420934628,190,56926,430943132],"time_section":[1098],"money_section":[],"time_topic":[],"primary_time_section":[430937767],"primary_money_section":[],"primary_time_topic":[],"paid":false,"display_modified_time":false,"_links":{"self":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4674774"}],"collection":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts"}],"author":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4674774\u002Fauthor"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4674774\u002Ffeaturedmedia"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fcategories?post=4674774"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags?post=4674774"},{"taxonomy":"topic","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftopics?post=4674774"}],"wp:meta":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4674774\u002Fmeta"}],"wp:attachment":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4674774\u002Fmedia"}],"fortune:featured":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4674774\u002Ffeatured"}],"fortune:related":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4674774\u002Frelated"}],"fortune:authors":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4674774\u002Fauthor class=\"video-container\"\u003E\u003Cvideo id=\"brightcove-player-5294815106001\" data-video-id=\"5294815106001\" data-account=\"293884104\" data-player=\"SJa0Thl7\" data-embed=\"default\" controls preload=\"auto\" class=\"video-js style","parent":0,"count":19439,"filter":"raw","all_sections":["entertainment"]}],"fortune:primary_topic":[{}]}},{"id":4677598,"date":"2017-02-22T07:00:11","date_gmt":"2017-02-22T12:00:11","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F?p=4677598"},"modified":"2017-02-22T07:00:00","modified_gmt":"2017-02-22T12:00:00","slug":"arrival-oscar-cinematography","type":"post","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4677598\u002Farrival-oscar-cinematography\u002F","title":{"rendered":"Inside the Cinematography of the Oscar-Nominated Movie \u003Ci\u003EArrival\u003C\u002Fi\u003E"},"content":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cem\u003E&ldquo;Cautious, yet mystified, Louise takes another bold action: She steps for the boundary. The light from that mist on the other side of that glass illuminates her face, showing her wonderment.&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIn the surprise hit movie \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4565975\u002Famy-adams-arrival\u002F\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EArrival\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, which is nominated for eight Academy Awards, linguistics professor Louise Banks (played by Amy Adams), is tasked with interpreting the language of a race of visiting aliens. In a dark, cavernous chamber aboard their spaceship, Louise moves from the shadows to the light &ndash; a dance that&rsquo;s mirrored throughout the movie as the character slowly comes to terms with the true lessons the arrival brings.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&ldquo;I think that journey from darkness to light is her journey,&rdquo; says \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fbradfordyoung.com\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EBradford Young\u003C\u002Fa\u003E,\u003Cem\u003E Arrival\u003C\u002Fem\u003E&rsquo;s cinematographer. Born in Louisville, Ky., Young has made his reputation with like \u003Cem\u003EA Most Violent Year\u003C\u002Fem\u003E and \u003Cem\u003ESelma\u003C\u002Fem\u003E, in which his mastery of available light helped convey the stories&rsquo; intimate natures. And that&rsquo;s what \u003Cem\u003EArrival\u003C\u002Fem\u003E&rsquo;s director Denis Villeneuve was looking for when he embarked on his first science-fiction film.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&ldquo;I was looking for a cinematographer with a very precise sensibility towards natural light,&rdquo; Villeneuve tells TIME. &ldquo;I wanted the movie to have strong roots in realism. I wanted a cinematographer who would not be afraid to deal with intimacy. It&rsquo;s a very specific sensibility that I felt in Bradford&rsquo;s previous work.&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ENowhere else is this play on light more apparent then aboard the spaceship, in the gloomy chamber where Louise spends much of her time. Villeneuve says that the set was specifically designed to be ominous and dark, a place where light is absorbed rather than reflected, a place that subliminally represents death. &ldquo;The main character is in a relationship with death,&rdquo; says Villeneuve. &ldquo;The more she learns about the Heptapod [alien] culture, the more it changes her perception of life, death and time.&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cfigure class=\"inline-portrait_small_2x aligncenter \"\u003E\u003Cimg data-attachment-id=\"4678276\" data-permalink=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4677598\u002Farrival-oscar-cinematography\u002Farrival-3\u002F\" data-orig-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Farrival-cinematography-oscars-97.jpg?quality=85\" data-orig-size=\"2560,1600\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta='{\"aperture\":\"3.5\",\"credit\":\"Photo credit: Jan Thijs\",\"camera\":\"Canon EOS 5D Mark III\",\"caption\":\"A scene from the film ARRIVAL by Paramount Pictures\",\"created_timestamp\":\"1437790058\",\"copyright\":\"Photo credit: Jan Thijs\",\"focal_length\":\"28\",\"iso\":\"3200\",\"shutter_speed\":\"0.0125\",\"title\":\"ARRIVAL\",\"orientation\":\"1\"}' data-image-title=\"ARRIVAL\" data-image-description=\"pA scene inside the spaceships chamber from the film Arrival by Paramount Pictures\u002Fp\n\" data-medium-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Farrival-cinematography-oscars-97.jpg?quality=85&w=300\" data-large-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Farrival-cinematography-oscars-97.jpg?quality=85&w=600\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Farrival-cinematography-oscars-97.jpg?w=560&#038;quality=85&#038;h=350\" alt=\"A scene inside the spaceship's chamber from the film \"Arrival\" by Paramount Pictures\" height=\"350\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigcaption class=\"image-caption\" \u003E\u003Cspan class=\"credit\" \u003EJan Thijs\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cspan class=\"caption\" \u003EA scene inside the spaceship&#8217;s chamber from the film &#8220;Arrival&#8221; by Paramount Pictures\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThat&rsquo;s where \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.kmreps.net\u002Fpatrice_vermette.html\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EPatrice Vermette\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, the film&rsquo;s production designer, comes in. &ldquo;With any movies I do, my process is very similar,&rdquo; Vermette tells TIME. &ldquo;I start by creating mood boards and collections of images that are only emotional reactions to the script. It could be colors, lights, marbles, rocks.&rdquo; Then, he and the director work out where to go with that inspiration. In this case, both men were deeply influenced by the artist \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fjamesturrell.com\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EJames Turrell\u003C\u002Fa\u003E&rsquo;s Shallow Space Constructions, a series of artworks that use light and space to question the nature of human perception. &ldquo;When I saw hundreds of people being hypnotized by James Turrell&rsquo;s light, I had an epiphany,&rdquo; says Villeneuve.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe cavernous chamber was born out of that experience. It is designed like a dark temple where the film&rsquo;s characters come to see the light &ndash; in this case, the aliens who remain semi-hidden behind a blinding rectangular white screen. Instead of using green screens, Vermette and his team actually built the ship&rsquo;s chamber. The physical space was humbling and also helped the director and cinematographer set up their shots, Villeneuve days, but the chamber&#8217;s bright screen was a challenge for Young.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"video-container\"\u003E\u003Cvideo id=\"brightcove-player-5331998482001\" data-video-id=\"5331998482001\" data-account=\"293884104\" data-player=\"SJa0Thl7\" data-embed=\"default\" controls preload=\"auto\" class=\"video-js responsive-video\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fvideo\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&ldquo;We had to be fearless,&rdquo; he says. &ldquo;We had to accept the fact that when Louise&rsquo;s very far from the screen she would be quite dark, and when she&rsquo;s right up on the screen, we would, for lack of a better term, overexpose her.&rdquo; But that was the point, he adds. &ldquo;This movie is about Louise&rsquo;s personal enlightenment. So you just submit to what the light offers and let that tell the story. It gave us the opportunity to let the lighting of the film mirror the journey of the character.&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThat concept is replicated in two other locations throughout the movie. In Louise&rsquo;s home, a large wall-to-wall window opens up to a blinding, yet hazy, lake, contrasting with the deliberate darkness of her living room. And inside the brutalist, fortress-like architecture of Louise&rsquo;s university, she faces a rectangular white board that opens up to a television announcing the aliens&rsquo; arrival. Again, light and darkness are at play, informing Louise&rsquo;s journey.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&ldquo;The structure of all these places work together,&rdquo; says Young. &ldquo;Those places make the spaceship that much more important and the spaceship makes those places that much more important. They are in a conversation with one another. They remind us of where Louise came from and where she&rsquo;s headed.&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EOutside of the spaceship, Young was inspired by the work of photographer \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.martinahooglandivanow.com\u002Fwork\u002Fspeedway\u002Findex.html\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EMartina Hoogland Ivanow\u003C\u002Fa\u003E to create a sense of dread and chaos in direct opposition to the Zen-like nature of Louise&rsquo;s safe and sacred zones. In her book, \u003Cem\u003ESpeedway\u003C\u002Fem\u003E, Ivanow creates gloomy, ominous images from mundane situations: a simple landscape becomes a Twin Peaks-like world where the unknown could be lurking in the dark; a motorcycle pilot is transformed into a shadowy, threatening figure.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cfigure class=\"inline-portrait_small_2x aligncenter \"\u003E\u003Cimg data-attachment-id=\"4678278\" data-permalink=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4677598\u002Farrival-oscar-cinematography\u002Fmhi_speedway_nr01___h30cm\u002F\" data-orig-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Fmhi_speedway_nr01___h30cm.jpg?quality=85\" data-orig-size=\"2000,1614\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta='{\"aperture\":\"0\",\"credit\":\"\",\"camera\":\"EskoScan F14\",\"caption\":\"\",\"created_timestamp\":\"0\",\"copyright\":\"\",\"focal_length\":\"0\",\"iso\":\"0\",\"shutter_speed\":\"0\",\"title\":\"\",\"orientation\":\"1\"}' data-image-title=\"mhi_speedway_nr01___h30cm\" data-image-description=\"pFrom the series Speedway\u002Fp\n\" data-medium-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Fmhi_speedway_nr01___h30cm.jpg?quality=85&w=300\" data-large-file=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Fmhi_speedway_nr01___h30cm.jpg?quality=85&w=600\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Fmhi_speedway_nr01___h30cm.jpg?w=560&#038;quality=85&#038;h=452\" alt=\"Martina Hoogland Ivanow\" height=\"452\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigcaption class=\"image-caption\" \u003E\u003Cspan class=\"credit\" \u003EMartina Hoogland Ivanow\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cspan class=\"caption\" \u003EFrom the series &#8220;Speedway&#8221;\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIn \u003Cem\u003EArrival\u003C\u002Fem\u003E, this is in play when we enter the military&rsquo;s compound set up near the spaceship. &ldquo;The calmness of the ship&rsquo;s chamber is in contrast with the interior of the tents,&rdquo; says Vermette. &ldquo;We realize that it&rsquo;s the human beings that are disturbing the peace and we can&rsquo;t wait to get back inside the spaceship.&rdquo; Toward the light &ndash; the one controlled by the aliens and the one under Young&rsquo;s spell. &ldquo;A light that brings a lot of intimacy, sensuality, fragility and humanity to the project,&rdquo; says Villeneuve.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cem\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EOlivier Laurent \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003Eis the editor of TIME LightBox. Follow him on \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002Folivierclaurent\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ETwitter\u003C\u002Fa\u003E and \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Finstagram.com\u002Folivierclaurent\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EInstagram\u003C\u002Fa\u003E \u003Ca href='https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.wordpress.com\u002Fmentions\u002Folivierclaurent\u002F' class='mention'\u003E\u003Cspan class='mentions-prefix'\u003E@\u003C\u002Fspan\u003Eolivierclaurent\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cem\u003EFollow \u003Cstrong\u003ETIME LightBox\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E on \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.facebook.com\u002Ftimelightbox\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EFacebook\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002Ftimepictures\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ETwitter\u003C\u002Fa\u003E and \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Finstagram.com\u002Ftimelightbox\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EInstagram\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["Cautious, yet mystified, Louise takes another bold action: She steps for the boundary. The main character is in a relationship with death, says Villeneuve. The more she learns about the Heptapod [alien] culture, the more it changes her perception of life, death and time."]},{"tag":"caption","attributes":{"id":"attachment_4678276","align":"aligncenter","width":"560"},"content":[{"tag":"img","attributes":{"src":"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Farrival-cinematography-oscars-97.jpg?w=560","alt":"A scene inside the spaceship&#039;s chamber from the film &quot;Arrival&quot; by Paramount Pictures","width":"560","height":"350"},"content":[]},{"tag":"br","attributes":[],"content":[]},{"tag":"figcaption","attributes":[],"content":["A scene inside the spaceship's chamber from the film \"Arrival\" by Paramount Pictures"]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[]},{"tag":"figcredit","attributes":[],"content":["Jan Thijs"]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Thats where ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.kmreps.net\u002Fpatrice_vermette.html"},"content":["Patrice Vermette"]},", the films production designer, comes in. With any movies I do, my process is very similar, Vermette tells TIME. I start by creating mood boards and collections of images that are only emotional reactions to the script. It could be colors, lights, marbles, rocks. Then, he and the director work out where to go with that inspiration. In this case, both men were deeply influenced by the artist ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fjamesturrell.com\u002F"},"content":["James Turrell"]},"s Shallow Space Constructions, a series of artworks that use light and space to question the nature of human perception. When I saw hundreds of people being hypnotized by James Turrells light, I had an epiphany, says Villeneuve."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The cavernous chamber was born out of that experience. In her book, ",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["Speedway"]},", Ivanow creates gloomy, ominous images from mundane situations: a simple landscape becomes a Twin Peaks-like world where the unknown could be lurking in the dark; a motorcycle pilot is transformed into a shadowy, threatening figure."]},{"tag":"caption","attributes":{"id":"attachment_4678278","align":"aligncenter","width":"560"},"content":[{"tag":"img","attributes":{"src":"https:\u002F\u002Ftimedotcom.files.wordpress.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002Fmhi_speedway_nr01___h30cm.jpg?w=560","alt":"Martina Hoogland Ivanow","width":"560","height":"452"},"content":[]},{"tag":"br","attributes":[],"content":[]},{"tag":"figcaption","attributes":[],"content":["From the series \"Speedway\""]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[]},{"tag":"figcredit","attributes":[],"content":["Martina Hoogland Ivanow"]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["In ",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["Arrival"]},", this is in play when we enter the militarys compound set up near the spaceship. The calmness of the ships chamber is in contrast with the interior of the tents, says Vermette. We realize that its the human beings that are disturbing the peace and we cant wait to get back inside the spaceship. Toward the light  the one controlled by the aliens and the one under Youngs spell. A light that brings a lot of intimacy, sensuality, fragility and humanity to the project, says Villeneuve."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"strong","attributes":[],"content":["Olivier Laurent "]},"is the editor of TIME LightBox. Follow him on ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002Folivierclaurent","target":"_blank"},"content":["Twitter"]}," and ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Finstagram.com\u002Folivierclaurent","target":"_blank"},"content":["Instagram"]}," @olivierclaurent"]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["Follow ",{"tag":"strong","attributes":[],"content":["TIME LightBox"]}," on ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.facebook.com\u002Ftimelightbox","target":"_blank"},"content":["Facebook"]},", ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002Ftimepictures","target":"_blank"},"content":["Twitter"]}," and ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"https:\u002F\u002Finstagram.com\u002Ftimelightbox\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["Instagram"]},"."]}]}],"plain":"&ldquo;Cautious, yet mystified, Louise takes another bold action: She steps for the boundary. The light from that mist on the other side of that glass illuminates her face, showing her wonderment.&rdquo; In the surprise hit movie Arrival, which is nominated for eight Academy Awards, linguistics professor Louise Banks (played by Amy Adams), is tasked with interpreting the language of a race of visiting aliens. In a dark, cavernous chamber aboard their spaceship, Louise moves from the shadows to the light &ndash; a dance that&rsquo;s mirrored throughout the movie as the character slowly comes to terms with the true lessons the arrival brings. &ldquo;I think that journey from darkness to light is her journey,&rdquo; says Bradford Young, Arrival&rsquo;s cinematographer. Born in Louisville, Ky., Young has made his reputation with like A Most Violent Year and Selma, in which his mastery of available light helped convey the stories&rsquo; intimate natures. And that&rsquo;s what Arrival&rsquo;s director Denis Villeneuve was looking for when he embarked on his first science-fiction film. &ldquo;I was looking for a cinematographer with a very precise sensibility towards natural light,&rdquo; Villeneuve tells TIME. &ldquo;I wanted the movie to have strong roots in realism. I wanted a cinematographer who would not be afraid to deal with intimacy. It&rsquo;s a very specific sensibility that I felt in Bradford&rsquo;s previous work.&rdquo; Nowhere else is this play on light more apparent then aboard the spaceship, in the gloomy chamber where Louise spends much of her time. Villeneuve says that the set was specifically designed to be ominous and dark, a place where light is absorbed rather than reflected, a place that subliminally represents death. &ldquo;The main character is in a relationship with death,&rdquo; says Villeneuve. &ldquo;The more she learns about the Heptapod [alien] culture, the more it changes her perception of life, death and time.&rdquo; Jan ThijsA scene inside the spaceship&#8217;s chamber from the film &#8220;Arrival&#8221; by Paramount Pictures That&rsquo;s where Patrice Vermette, the film&rsquo;s production designer, comes in. &ldquo;With any movies I do, my process is very similar,&rdquo; Vermette tells TIME. &ldquo;I start by creating mood boards and collections of images that are only emotional reactions to the script. It could be colors, lights, marbles, rocks.&rdquo; Then, he and the director work out where to go with that inspiration. In this case, both men were deeply influenced by the artist James Turrell&rsquo;s Shallow Space Constructions, a series of artworks that use light and space to question the nature of human perception. &ldquo;When I saw hundreds of people being hypnotized by James Turrell&rsquo;s light, I had an epiphany,&rdquo; says Villeneuve. The cavernous chamber was born out of that experience. It is designed like a dark temple where the film&rsquo;s characters come to see the light &ndash; in this case, the aliens who remain semi-hidden behind a blinding rectangular white screen. Instead of using green screens, Vermette and his team actually built the ship&rsquo;s chamber. The physical space was humbling and also helped the director and cinematographer set up their shots, Villeneuve days, but the chamber&#8217;s bright screen was a challenge for Young. &ldquo;We had to be fearless,&rdquo; he says. &ldquo;We had to accept the fact that when Louise&rsquo;s very far from the screen she would be quite dark, and when she&rsquo;s right up on the screen, we would, for lack of a better term, overexpose her.&rdquo; But that was the point, he adds. &ldquo;This movie is about Louise&rsquo;s personal enlightenment. So you just submit to what the light offers and let that tell the story. It gave us the opportunity to let the lighting of the film mirror the journey of the character.&rdquo; That concept is replicated in two other locations throughout the movie. In Louise&rsquo;s home, a large wall-to-wall window opens up to a blinding, yet hazy, lake, contrasting with the deliberate darkness of her living room. And inside the brutalist, fortress-like architecture of Louise&rsquo;s university, she faces a rectangular white board that opens up to a television announcing the aliens&rsquo; arrival. Again, light and darkness are at play, informing Louise&rsquo;s journey. &ldquo;The structure of all these places work together,&rdquo; says Young. &ldquo;Those places make the spaceship that much more important and the spaceship makes those places that much more important. They are in a conversation with one another. They remind us of where Louise came from and where she&rsquo;s headed.&rdquo; Outside of the spaceship, Young was inspired by the work of photographer Martina Hoogland Ivanow to create a sense of dread and chaos in direct opposition to the Zen-like nature of Louise&rsquo;s safe and sacred zones. In her book, Speedway, Ivanow creates gloomy, ominous images from mundane situations: a simple landscape becomes a Twin Peaks-like world where the unknown could be lurking in the dark; a motorcycle pilot is transformed into a shadowy, threatening figure. Martina Hoogland IvanowFrom the series &#8220;Speedway&#8221; In Arrival, this is in play when we enter the military&rsquo;s compound set up near the spaceship. &ldquo;The calmness of the ship&rsquo;s chamber is in contrast with the interior of the tents,&rdquo; says Vermette. &ldquo;We realize that it&rsquo;s the human beings that are disturbing the peace and we can&rsquo;t wait to get back inside the spaceship.&rdquo; Toward the light &ndash; the one controlled by the aliens and the one under Young&rsquo;s spell. &ldquo;A light that brings a lot of intimacy, sensuality, fragility and humanity to the project,&rdquo; says Villeneuve. Olivier Laurent is the editor of TIME LightBox. Follow him on Twitter and Instagram @olivierclaurent Follow TIME LightBox on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram."},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EDirector Denis Villeneuve and cinematographer Bradford Young explain how they created the Arrival&#8217;s visual identity\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n"},"author":703985,"featured_media":4678274,"comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"format":"standard","categories":[1],"tags":[58298,102653,430952869,31112,7243342,5160,56926,436],"time_section":[1098,326619029],"money_section":[],"time_topic":[],"primary_time_section":[430937791],"primary_money_section":[],"primary_time_topic":[],"paid":false,"display_modified_time":false,"_links":{"self":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4677598"}],"collection":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts"}],"author":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4677598\u002Fauthor"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4677598\u002Ffeaturedmedia"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fcategories?post=4677598"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags?post=4677598"},{"taxonomy":"topic","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftopics?post=4677598"}],"wp:meta":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4677598\u002Fmeta"}],"wp:attachment":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4677598\u002Fmedia"}],"fortune:featured":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4677598\u002Ffeatured"}],"fortune:related":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4677598\u002Frelated"}],"fortune:authors":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F46 You Need to Know About the 2017 Oscars"},"content":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EIt&#8217;s Oscars time again, and this year, Hollywood will not only be celebrating Hollywood, it will be celebrating a \u003Cem\u003Emovie\u003C\u002Fem\u003E that celebrates Hollywood (that would be \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4594589\u002Fla-la-land-opening-scene-musical-another-day-of-sun\u002F\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003ELa La Land\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, of the 14 nominations). And while we don&#8217;t know who will win at the 89th Academy Awards, we can predict with some degree of confidence that there will be political speeches (\u003Cspan class=\"s1\"\u003Esee: \u003Cspan class=\"s2\"\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4628072\u002Fgolden-globes-2017-meryl-streep-donald-trump-speech\u002F\"\u003EMeryl Streep\u003C\u002Fa\u003E at the Golden Globes)\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E, there will be Jimmy Kimmel\u002FMatt Damon gags and records will be broken. Here&#8217;s everything you need to know before tuning in on Sunday, Feb. 26 at 8:30 p.m. ET on ABC.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003EWho&rsquo;s hosting? \u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EJimmy Kimmel will host the ceremony for the first time, taking on the duty performed in recent years by Chris Rock, Neil Patrick Harris and Ellen DeGeneres. His attitude toward the whole affair so far has been characteristically nonchalant&mdash;he joked on his show that the producers selected him for his \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4592103\u002Fjimmy-kimmel-on-oscars\u002F\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Ephysical proximity\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E to the Dolby Theatre\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E. The announcement also provided fuel for his long-running \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4473441\u002Fjimmy-kimmel-matt-damon-feud-history-timeline\u002F\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Efaux-feud with Matt Damon\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E. Kimmel says he \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4638415\u002Foscars-2017-jimmy-kimmel-hopes-matt-damon-loses\u002F\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Ehopes Damon loses\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E (he&rsquo;s nominated for Best Picture as a producer of \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EManchester by the Sea\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E), while Damon told the \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.hollywoodreporter.com\u002Fnews\u002Foscars-matt-damon-financial-risks-making-manchester-by-sea-advice-host-frenemy-jimmy-kimmel-974\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EHollywood Reporter\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E that he hopes Kimmel &ldquo;live[s] up to my extremely low expectations.&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EMORE\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4673744\u002Foscars-2017-how-to-watch\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EHere&rsquo;s How You Can Watch the 2017 Oscars\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003EWho&rsquo;s presenting? \u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EAs is customary, last year&rsquo;s \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4240519\u002Foscars-2016-winners-list\u002F\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Eacting winners\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E&mdash;Brie Larson, Leonardo DiCaprio, Alicia Vikander and Mark Rylance&mdash;will present awards to this year&rsquo;s honorees. Other presenters include past Oscar winners Halle Berry and Shirley MacLaine and nominees Hailee Steinfeld and Samuel L. Jackson. Dakota Johnson and Jamie Dornan will be there to make a TV-appropriate joke about \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4663696\u002Ffifty-shades-darker-review\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EBDSM\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, Chris Evans to continue repping good old \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4667314\u002Fchris-evans-on-david-duke\u002F\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003ESteve Rogers\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E and Kate McKinnon to hopefully do something deliciously unhinged to wake us up should we happen to doze off during the speeches&mdash;er, commercials.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003EWho&rsquo;s performing? \u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EAll five numbers nominated for Best Original Song will be performed during the ceremony. Auli&rsquo;i Cravalho, who voices the title character in \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EMoana\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E, will join songwriter Lin-Manuel Miranda for the empowering &ldquo;How Far I&rsquo;ll Go.&rdquo; Sting will sing &ldquo;The Empty Chair&rdquo; from the documentary \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EJim: The James Foley Story\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E. Justin Timberlake will perform &ldquo;\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fcollection-post\u002F4577404\u002Fthe-top-10-worst-songs\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ECan&rsquo;t Stop the Feeling\u003C\u002Fa\u003E,&rdquo; from \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003ETrolls\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E, also known as The Song That Will Probably Still Be Playing Constantly When You Are on Your Deathbed. And \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003ELa La Land \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Estar John Legend will perform the movie&rsquo;s two nominated songs, sung in the movie by Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone, presumably to allow the two nominees to direct their energies to nervously waiting to see if their lives are about to change \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Eforever\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EMORE\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4607907\u002Flin-manuel-miranda-donald-trump\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ELin-Manuel Miranda: How to Be an Artist in the Donald Trump Era\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003EWho&rsquo;s expected to win? \u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003ELa La Land \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Eboasts an impressive \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E14 nominations, an honor shared only by \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003ETitanic \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Eand \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EAll About Eve\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E, and one which puts within reach the prospect of breaking the record of 11 wins. In the acting categories, Emma Stone (\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003ELa La Land\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E), Casey Affleck (\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EManchester by the Sea\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E), Viola Davis (\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EFences\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E) and Mahershala Ali (\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EMoonlight\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E) all have the edge on their respective categories. \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003ELa La Land \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Ealso looks strong in the directing and music categories&mdash;but nothing is on lock, of course, and a surprise or two would jazz up (or jazz down, if it involves \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003ELa La Land \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Elosing) the whole affair. (Read our \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4674774\u002Foscars-2017-predictions\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Efull list of predictions\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.)\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003EIs there anything different about this year&rsquo;s ceremony? \u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EAfter two years with zero non-white acting nominees (and a \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Flabs.time.com\u002Fstory\u002Foscars-diversity\u002F\"\u003Every long history\u003C\u002Fa\u003E with disproportionately few), this year&rsquo;s nominations are much \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4644539\u002Foscar-nominations-diversity-hollywood\u002F\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003Emore inclusive\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E: seven of the 20 nominees are people of color. But change, unsurprisingly, is slow, and we&rsquo;re still without any female directing nominees, and limited to no representation when it comes to Asian Americans, Latinos, Native Americans, LGBT and gender-nonconforming people and people with disabilities.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003EAny controversies to look out for? \u003C\u002Fb\u003ETwo nominees are considered especially controversial this year:\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E Best Actor nominee Casey Affleck&mdash;after two \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4645846\u002Fwhat-to-know-about-the-casey-affleck-oscar-controversy\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Esexual harassment suits\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, which were settled in 2010, resurfaced in the news\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E&mdash;and Best Director nominee Mel Gibson, whose nomination represents a Hollywood comeback after a \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.nytimes.com\u002F2010\u002F07\u002F22\u002Fmovies\u002F22gibson.html\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Edomestic violence charge\u003C\u002Fa\u003E and a highly publicized anti-Semitic outburst.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003EAny records to be broken? \u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EThis year&rsquo;s ceremony could bring a slew of firsts. Barry Jenkins could be the first black filmmaker to win Best Director.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E \u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EHis movie, \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003EMoonlight\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight:400;\"\u003E, could be the first film with a gay protagonist to win Best Picture. Ava DuVernay could become the first black woman to win Best Documentary, Denzel Washington could beat his own record for most awards by a black actor, and Meryl Streep could tie Katharine Hepburn for most acting awards ever (with four)&mdash;male or female, lead or supporting. And on the young prodigy front, \u003Cem\u003ELa La Land\u003C\u002Fem\u003E&#8216;s Damien Chazelle, 32, could tie 1932 winner Norman Taurog for youngest Best Director winner, and \u003Cem\u003EManchester by the Sea\u003C\u002Fem\u003E&#8216;s Lucas Hedges, 20, could tie 1981 winner Timothy Hutton for youngest Best Supporting Actor.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EMORE \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4662871\u002Fava-duvernay-13th-documentary-interview\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EAva DuVernay on Her Oscar-Nominated Documentary \u003Cem\u003E13th\u003C\u002Fem\u003E and Resistance Through Art\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["It's Oscars time again, and this year, Hollywood will not only be celebrating Hollywood, it will be celebrating a ",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["movie"]}," that celebrates Hollywood (that would be ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4594589\u002Fla-la-land-opening-scene-musical-another-day-of-sun\u002F"},"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["La La Land"]}]},", of the 14 nominations).
